00025 #ifndef _BASE_SERIALIZER_
00026 #define _BASE_SERIALIZER_
00027 
00028 #include <base/base>
00029 #include <base/Object>
00030 #include <base/Referenced>
00031 #include <base/ref>
00032 #include <base/serialization_error>
00033 #include <base/VFile>
00034 
00035 #include <iostream>
00036 
00037 
00038 namespace base {
00039 
00040 class Serializable;
00041 
00042 
00043 class Serializer : public Object
00044 {
00045 public:
00046   enum SerializerType { Input=0, Output=1 };
00047   Serializer(SerializerType type);
00048   Serializer(ref<VFile> archive, SerializerType type); 
00049   Serializer(std::ios& stream, SerializerType type);
00050   virtual ~Serializer();
00051 
00052   virtual bool isOutput() const { return output; }
00053   virtual bool isInput() const { return !isOutput(); }
00054 
00059   // Serialization of simple types (& String)
00060   virtual Serializer& operator()(char& c) = 0;
00061   virtual Serializer& operator()(const char& c) = 0;
00062 
00063   virtual Serializer& operator()(Byte& b) = 0;
00064   virtual Serializer& operator()(const Byte& b) = 0;
00065 
00066   virtual Serializer& operator()(bool& b) = 0;
00067   virtual Serializer& operator()(const bool& b) = 0;
00068 
00069   virtual Serializer& operator()(SInt& i) = 0;
00070   virtual Serializer& operator()(const SInt& i) = 0;
00071 
00072   virtual Serializer& operator()(Int& i) = 0;
00073   virtual Serializer& operator()(const Int& i) = 0;
00074 
00075   virtual Serializer& operator()(LInt& i) = 0;
00076   virtual Serializer& operator()(const LInt& i) = 0;
00077 
00078   virtual Serializer& operator()(String& s) = 0;
00079   virtual Serializer& operator()(const String& s) = 0;
00080 
00081   virtual Serializer& operator()(Real& r) = 0;
00082   virtual Serializer& operator()(const Real& r) = 0;
00083 
00084   Serializer& operator[](Serializable& r);
00085   Serializer& operator[](const Serializable& r);
00086 
00087 
00088   // serialization of references complex types (derived from Serializable),
00089   //  references (ref<T>, T derived from Serializable), and supported containers
00090   //  (e.g. array)
00091 
00092   class SerializableInstantiator {
00093   public:
00094     virtual Serializable* newSerializable() = 0;
00095   };
00096 
00097   template<class SerializableDerived>
00098   class SerializableDerivedInstantiator : public SerializableInstantiator
00099   {
00100   public:
00101     virtual Serializable* newSerializable() { return NewObj SerializableDerived(); }
00102   };
00103 
00104 
00105   template<class T>
00106   Serializer& operator[](ref<T>& r)
00107   {
00108     typename ref<T>::PointerType p = GetImpl(r);
00109     
00110     Serializable* sp = 0;
00111     if (p!=0) {
00112       if (!instanceof(*p,Serializable))
00113   throw serialization_error(Exception("can only archive references to Serializable derived classes (ref<Serializable>)"));
00114       sp = dynamic_cast<Serializable*>(p);
00115     }
00116 
00117     if (!output) {
00118       SerializableDerivedInstantiator<T> i;
00119       serializePointer(sp,(sp==0)?&i:0);
00120       p = dynamic_cast<typename ref<T>::PointerType>(sp);
00121       Reset(r,p);  
00122     }
00123     else
00124       serializePointer(sp,0);
00125 
00126     return *this;
00127   }
00128 
00129 
00130   // assumes Archive is output
00131   template<class T>
00132   Serializer& operator[](const ref<T>& r)
00133   {
00134     if (!output)
00135       throw serialization_error(Exception("can't input to a const ref<>"));
00136 
00137     typename ref<T>::PointerType p = GetImpl(r);
00138 
00139     if (!instanceof(*p,Serializable))
00140       throw serialization_error(Exception("can only archive references to Serializable derived classes (ref<Serializable>)"));
00141     Serializable* sp = dynamic_cast<Serializable*>(p);
00142 
00143     serializePointer(sp,0);
00144     return *this;
00145   }
00146 
00147 
00148   // array
00149   template<class T>
00150   Serializer& operator[](array<T>& a)
00151   {
00152     Int size = a.size();
00153     operator()(size);
00154     for(Int i=0; i<a.size(); i++)
00155       operator()(a.at(i));
00156     return *this;
00157   }
00158 
00159   template<class T>
00160   Serializer& operator[](const array<T>& a)
00161   {
00162     if (!output)
00163       throw serialization_error(Exception("can't input to a const array<>"));
00164 
00165     Int size = a.size();
00166     operator()(size);
00167     for(Int i=0; i<a.size(); i++)
00168       operator()(a[i]);
00169     return *this;
00170   }
00171 
00172   // std::list
00173   template<class T>
00174   Serializer& operator[](std::list<T>& l)
00175   {
00176     if (output) {
00177       Int size = l.size();
00178       operator()(size);
00179       std::list<T>::iterator i = l.begin();
00180       std::list<T>::iterator end = l.end();
00181       while (i != end) {
00182   operator()(*i);
00183   ++i;
00184       }
00185     }
00186     else {
00187       l.clear();
00188       Int size;
00189       operator()(size);
00190       if (size > 0) {
00191   T e;
00192   for(Int i=0; i<size; i++) {
00193     operator()(e);
00194     l.push_back( e );
00195   }
00196       }
00197     }
00198 
00199     return *this;
00200   }
00201 
00202   template<class T>
00203   Serializer& operator[](const array<T>& a)
00204   {
00205     Int size = a.size();
00206     operator()(size);
00207     for(Int i=0; i<a.size(); i++)
00208       opreator()(a[i]);
00209     return *this;
00210   }
00211 
00212 
00213   virtual void flush() = 0;
00214 
00215 protected:  
00216   Serializer(const Serializer&) : output(output) {}
00217 
00218   bool output;
00219 
00220   virtual void serializePointer(Serializable*& p, SerializableInstantiator* i) = 0;
00221 };

00224 } // base
